title: Vai Toutai
text:
Vai Toutai (born 28 January 1993) is a <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who last played as a and on the for the <a href="Blacktown%20Workers%20Sea%20Eagles">Blacktown Workers Sea Eagles</a> in the <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Campbelltown%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Campbelltown, New South Wales</a>, Toutai is of <a href="Tonga">Tonga</a>n descent and attended Eagle Vale High School. He played his junior rugby league for <a href="Campbelltown%20City%20Kangaroos">Campbelltown City Kangaroos</a> and Fairfield United before being signed by the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
Playing career.
2013.
Toutai played for Parramatta's <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team in 2011 and 2012, scoring 12 tries in 29 games.
In round 2 of the <a href="2013%20NRL%20season">2013 NRL season</a>, Toutai made his <a href="NRL">NRL</a> debut for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Eels</a> against the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a>, replacing injured winger <a href="Ken%20Sio">Ken Sio</a> in the Eels 20-16 loss at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>. In his next match in round 3 against the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>, Toutai scored his NRL first try in the Eels 31-18 loss at <a href="Leichhardt%20Oval">Leichhardt Oval</a>. Toutai finished off his debut year with him playing in 15 matches and scoring 4 tries (16p) as the club finished last on the table for a second consecutive year.
2014.
On 14 February 2014, Toutai was selected in the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Eels</a> inaugural <a href="2014%20NRL%20Auckland%20Nines">2014 NRL Auckland Nines</a> squad. In round 1 against the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a>, Toutai scored a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in the Eels 36-16 win at <a href="Parramatta%20Stadium">Parramatta Stadium</a>. On 5 June 2014, Toutai extended his contract with the Eels for a further 3 years till the end of the <a href="2017%20NRL%20season">2017 NRL season</a>. On the 19 July 2014, Toutai dropped the ball over the line twice in a 32-12 defeat by South Sydney. In round 23 against the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>, Toutai was the centre of the Eels controversial 18-16 loss after Toutai received a pass from the Eels <a href="ball%20boy">ball boy</a> after halfback <a href="Chris%20Sandow">Chris Sandow</a> kicked a 40/20 then Toutai passing the ball to Sandow to race over to score the winning try for the Eels but was disallowed after the <a href="ball%20boy">ball boy</a> didn't place the ball on the ground. Toutai finished off the Eels <a href="2014%20NRL%20season">2014 season</a> having played in 10 matches and scoring 8 tries. On 16 October 2014, he was named in the <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a> squad to play against the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea national rugby league team</a> in <a href="Lae">Lae</a>. He played on the wing in Tonga's 32-18 loss.
2015.
Toutai appeared in two matches for the Eels in the <a href="2015%20NRL%20season">2015 season</a>.
2016.
On 1 February, Toutai was named in the Eels' <a href="2016%20NRL%20Auckland%20Nines">2016 NRL Auckland Nines</a> squad. On 7 May, he played for Tonga against <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> in the <a href="Pacific%20Rugby%20League%20International%23Polynesian%20Cup%202">2016 Polynesian Cup</a>. In December 2016, Toutai's contract with Parramatta was terminated after it was revealed he was involved in a brawl with Outlaw Bikie member in which he glassed them with a bottle. The Bikie reportedly vowed to exact revenge on Toutai.
2018.
After a year out of the game, Toutai signed a contract to join <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a> side the <a href="Blacktown%20Workers%20Sea%20Eagles">Blacktown Workers Sea Eagles</a>.
